channel.title: Software on PowerUp ☆ Video Game & Technology Resource
channel.description: Recent content in Software on PowerUp ☆ Video Game & Technology Resource

item.title: Windows
item.description:
Security

Antivirus

Antivirus ratings can be found at av-test.org

  • Avast (free)
  • Bitdefender (free edition)
  • Eset
  • Kaspersky
  • Malwarebytes
    • Anti-Exploit
    • Anti-Rootkit

Maintenance

  • Speccy
    • System information and temperature monitor.
    • If system temperatures are too high, check the fans and vents for dust, clean with compressed air.
  • CCleaner
    • Junk cleaner and registry repair.
  • Defraggler
    • Defrag hard drive (do not defrag SSD).
  • WinDirStat
    • Hard drive usage visualizer and cleanup.
    • Use this to analyze disk space if running low.
  • Crystal Disk Info
    • Hard Drive / SSD health monitor.
    • Check the disk for bad sectors and replace if in critical condition.

Productivity

  • LibreOffice
    • Free, open-source office suite and compatible alternative to Microsoft Office.
  • Krita
    • Free Digital painting application.
  • Lightworks
    • Free and Paid video editor supporting resolutions up to 4K.
  • Thunderbird
    • Cross-platform email, news, and chat client.
  • Visual Studio Code
    • Text editor redefined and optimized for building and debugging modern web and cloud applications.
  • 7-Zip
    • Archive compression utility that supports multiple formats.

See more Windows Applications.

Performance

Startup Programs

Disable unwanted startup programs to free system resources and speed up computer.

Windows Vista & 7

  • Launch the System Configuration by going to the Start Menu → type msconfig in the search.
  • Uncheck the programs you do not want running at startup.

Windows 8 & 10

  • Press Ctrl+Shift+Esc to bring up the Task Manager → Click the Startup tab.
  • Right click and Disable programs you do not want running at startup.

Visual Effects

  • Go to Start Menu → type Appearance and Performance
  • In the Performance Options window you can disable unneeded effects.

Hibernation

Hiberfil.sys can use several GB of hard disk space. If not needed it can be removed.

  • Hiberfil.sys is a hidden file located at C:\hiberfil.sys
  • Open Command Prompt as Administrator
  • Enter: powercfg -h off
  • Restart the PC
  • The file should now be automatically removed. If it remains, it can be deleted manually.

Virtual Memory

The Pagefile is the reserved portion of a hard disk that is used as an extension of RAM. Windows sets the initial minimum size of the Pagefile equal to the amount of RAM installed on your computer. It can be manually set higher if too low. Do not disable the Pagefile.

  1. Click the Start Button → Right Click My Computer or This PC → Go to Properties
  2. Go to Advanced System Settings → Under Performance click Settings
  3. In the Performance Options window click the Advanced tab
  4. Click Change Virtual Memory
  5. Choose your C: Drive → Click Custom Size
  6. Set, in Megabytes, Initial and Maximum size to 1.5 times the amount of your computer's RAM.
    1. (e.g. 1GB RAM = 1000MB)
    2. (e.g. 1.5 x 4GB RAM = 6000MB)
  7. Click Set → Apply → Ok → Restart PC to take effect

Power Options

In the Control Panel, under System and Security, find Power Options.
Click Change plan settings → Click Change advanced power settings
You can set to High perfomance or set options individually
Note: High Performance will be harder on your CPU and use more power.

Network

DNS

Third-party DNS servers can be faster than your Internet Service Providor's depending on your location. Try Google's Public DNS, 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4.

  1. Go to Control Panel → Network → Network and Sharing Center → Change Adapter Settings
  2. Right click on your Local Area or Wireless connection and go to Properties.
  3. Scroll down to IPv4 and click Properties.
  4. Choose "Use the following DNS server addresses" and enter the address.

Telemery

Removing Windows Data Collection

Windows 7 & 8

Windows Update

  • Remove the following updates (if installed already):
  • Go to Control Panel → Uninstall a program → View installed updates
  • KB3068708 Update for customer experience and diagnostic telemetry.
  • KB3022345 Update for customer experience and diagnostic telemetry.
  • KB2952664 Compatibility update for upgrading Windows 7.
  • KB2990214 Update that enables you to upgrade from Windows 7 to a later version of Windows.
  • KB3035583 Update installs Get Windows 10 app in Windows 8.1 and Windows 7 SP1.
  • KB971033 Description of the update for Windows Activation Technologies.
  • KB3021917 Update to Windows 7 SP1 for performance improvements.
  • KB3044374 Update that enables you to upgrade from Windows 8.1 to a later version of Windows.

Action Center

  • Go to Control Panel → Action Center → Change Action Center Settings
  • Click Customer Experience Improvement Program settings
  • Choose No

Command Prompt

  • Open Command Prompt as Administrator
  • Enter:
    sc stop Diagtrack
sc delete Diagtrack
sc delete dmwappushservice

Tasks

  • Go to Start Menu → Type task scheduler
  • Disable under:
    • Microsoft → Windows → Application Experience
      • AITAgent
      • ProgramDataUpdater
      • Customer Experience Improvement Program
      • Under Disk Diagnostic, disable only Microsoft-Windows-DiskDiagnosticDataCollector
      • Maintenance → WinSAT
      • Media Center → Status column

Services

  • Go to Start Menu → Type services
  • Disable Remote Registry

Windows 10

To fully disable Telemetry you will need Windows 10 Enterprise Edition.
Install O&O ShutUp 10 and apply recommended settings.

Privacy Settings

  • Go to Start Menu → Settings → Privacy
  • Disable everything that can track data
  • Set Feedback & diagnostics to Never

Command Pompt

  • Open Command Prompt as Administrator
  • Enter:
    sc stop Diagtrack
sc delete Diagtrack

  • sc delete dmwappushservice

Registry

  • Go to Start Menu → Type regedit
  • Go to the registry key:
  • HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\DataCollection
  • Create a new a 32-bit DWORD value named AllowTelemetry and set it to 0.
  • Go to C:\Windows\System32\Drivers\Etc\
  • Open the hosts file with a text editor
  • Add the IP's from this list http://pastebin.com/AbTqLqwY

Group Policy

  • Go to Start Menu → Type gpedit
  • Go to Computer Configuration → Administrative Templates → Windows Components → Data Collection and Preview Builds
  • Double Click Allow Telemetry
    • If you are on Windows 10 Home or Pro set to Disabled
    • If you are on Windows 10 Enterprise set to Enabled → Options: 0 Off [Enterprise Only]
  • Under Windows Components, go to One Drive
    • Double click Prevent the usage of OneDrive for file storage → Set to Enabled
  • Under Windows Components, go to Windows Defender
  • Double click Turn off Windows Defender → Set to Enabled

Tasks

  • Go to Start Menu → Type task scheduler
  • Disable everything under Microsoft → Windows →
    • Application Experience
    • Autochk
    • Customer Experience Improvement Program
    • Under Disk Diagnostic, disable only Microsoft-Windows-DiskDiagnosticDataCollector
    • Maintenance

Services

  • Go to Start Menu → Type services
  • Disable Remote Registry

Cortana

  • Go to Start Menu → Type Cortana & Search Settings
  • Turn off Cortana
  • The follwing will also disable Start Menu search:
    • Download and install Unlocker
    • Navigate to the following folder:
    • C:\Windows\SystemApps\Microsoft.Windows.Cortana_cw5n1h2txyewy
    • Right click "SearchUI.exe" and select "Unlocker"
    • Under the action menu, select "Rename"
    • Give it a new name such as "Disabled.SearchUI.exe"
    • Restart PC

item.title: Chrome
item.description:
Builds

Chrome
Stable release.
Beta
Try out new features early.
Canary
An experimental developer channel.
Chromium
Open-source project from which Google draws its source code.

Recommended Extensions

uBlock Origin
Ad Blocker that's easy on memory and CPU, yet can load thousands more filters than other popular blockers.
HTTPS Everywhere
Browser extension that encrypts your communications with many major websites.
Privacy Badger
Automatically analyze and block any tracker or ad that violates the principle of user consent.
uMatrix
A point-and-click matrix-based firewall, with many privacy-enhancing tools.
Tapermonkey
The most popular userscript manager for Chrome.

item.title: FFmpeg
item.description:
A complete, cross-platform solution to record, convert and stream audio and video.

Installation

Download

Move FFmpeg folder to a location of your choice, such as C:\Program Files\.

Enable FFmpeg Through Command Prompt

  1. Control Panel → System and Security → System → Advanced system settings
  2. Advanced Tab → Environment Variables → System variables → Path
  3. Add C:\Program Files\FFmpeg\ (Separate multiple paths with semicolon ;)

Typing ffmpeg in CMD will now launch without needing to specify a direct path.

Linux Compile

sudo apt-get install git yasm
 
sudo apt-get install -y autoconf dh-autoreconf automake build-essential libgnutls28-dev
 
sudo apt-get install -y libass-dev libfreetype6-dev libsdl1.2-dev libtheora-dev libtool libva-dev libvdpau-dev libvorbis-dev libxcb1-dev libxcb-shm0-dev libxcb-xfixes0-dev pkg-config texinfo zlib1g-dev libx264-dev libvorbis-dev libvpx-dev libfdk-aac-dev libopenjpeg-dev zlib1g-dev libavcodec-extra openssl libssl-dev
 
autoreconf -i
 
mkdir ~/src
cd ~/src
git clone http://source.ffmpeg.org/git/ffmpeg.git
cd ffmpeg
 
./configure --enable-version3 --enable-gnutls --enable-gpl --enable-nonfree --disable-shared --enable-libfdk-aac --enable-libx264 --enable-libvorbis --enable-libvpx --enable-decoder=png --enable-encoder=png --enable-libopenjpeg --enable-openssl --enable-postproc --enable-swscale --enable-avfilter
 
make && make install
 
sudo cp ~/src/ffmpeg/ffmpeg /usr/local/bin
sudo cp ~/src/ffmpeg/ffprobe /usr/local/bin
sudo cp ~/src/ffmpeg/ffserver /usr/local/bin

Command-line Parameters

ffmpeg -i [input file] [video codec] [video encoding] [video bit rate] [audio codec] [audio encoding] [audio bit rate] [additional options] [output file]

WEBM

ffmpeg -i input.avi -vcodec libvpx -b:v 1500K -crf 10 -pix_fmt yuv420p -deadline good -acodec libvorbis -quality good -cpu-used 0 -b:a 320k -sn -threads 2 -movflags faststart output.webm

MP4

ffmpeg -i input.avi -vcodec -crf libx264 18 -qcomp 0.8 -preset medium -acodec aac -strict experimental -b:a 400k -threads 2 output.mp4

GIF

ffmpeg -i input.avi -vf palettegen output.png
ffmpeg -i input.avi -i output.png -lavfi paletteuse -r 14 output.gif

Giflossy

ffmpeg -i input.avi -i output.png -lavfi paletteuse -r 14 output.gif && gifsicle -03 --lossy=80 --colors 256 -o output.gif input.gif

Cut

ffmpeg -i input.avi -ss 00:00:01 -to 00:00:15 -vcodec copy -vcodec copy output.webm

Scale

VP8

-vf scale=1280:720

Auto

-vf scale=-1:720

x264

Aspect must be divisible by 2

-vf scale="trunc(iw/2)*2:trunc(ih/2)*2"
-vf scale=1280:720
-vf scale="1281:721, crop=1280:720:0:0"

Auto

-vf scale=-2:720

Thumbnail

ffmpeg -y -i input.webm -vf "scale=674:-1, crop=500:280" -q:v 7 -ss 00:00:01.000 -vframes 1 output.jpg

item.title: Firefox
item.description:
Builds

Firefox
Stable release.
Beta
Try out new features early.
Developer
An experimental developer channel.
Nightly
For testing purposes only.

Recommended Add-ons

Decentraleyes
Protects you against tracking through free, centralized, content delivery.
uBlock Origin
Ad Blocker that's easy on memory and CPU, yet can load thousands more filters than other popular blockers.
HTTPS Everywhere
Browser extension that encrypts your communications with many major websites.
NoScript
Blocks malicious scripts and allows JavaScript and Java content only from sites you trust.
Privacy Badger
Automatically analyze and block any tracker or ad that violates the principle of user consent.
Better Privacy
Remove or manage a new and uncommon kind of cookies, better known as LSO's.
Classic Theme Restorer
Use this if you prefer the old look of Firefox or if you want to customize the UI.
Greasemonkey
Customize the way a web page displays or behaves with Userscripts.
Speed Tweaks
Provides a list to almost all the settings that you may need to alter in order to enhance Firefox's speed.

item.title: GNU/Linux
item.description:
Distributions

Debian
One of the earliest Linux distributions. Stable, Testing, and Unstable releases.
Ubuntu
Commercially sponsored, Debian-derived. 6 month release cycle. Server Editions.
Mint
Debian/Ubuntu-based. Full multimedia support out of the box. 6 month release cycle.
Red Hat
Red Hat Enterprise Linux is targeted toward the commercial market.
Fedora
Sponsored by Red Hat.
6 month release cycle.
Server Edition.
CentOS
A free rebuild of source packages from the Red Hat Enterprise Linux. 2 year release cycle.
openSUSE
User-friendly desktop, tools for developers and sysadmins. 12 month release cycle.
PCLinuxOS
Aimed at ease of use. Script which allows hard drive snapshots to ISO. Rolling Release.
Mageia
Stable and trustable governance to direct collaborative projects. 9 month release cycle.
Arch
Focuses on simplicity of design. Installed without a graphical front-end. Rolling release.
Gentoo
Software is compiled locally from source code. Rolling release.
Slackware
The original Linux distribution, geared towards power and stability.
Puppy
Lightweight, small installation. The entire system can be run from RAM.
Dragora
GNU/Linux-Libre. Simple packaging system. Endorsed by the FSF.
Android-x86
Project to port Android x86 platform.

More at www.distrowatch.com.

Setup

  • Arch
  • Debian
  • Fedora
  • openSUSE
  • Ubuntu

Package Managers

  • Apt
  • Aptitude
  • DNF
  • DPKG
  • Entropy
  • OpenPKG
  • OPKG
  • pacman
  • Portage
  • RPM
  • Slackpkg

Desktop Environments

  • Budgie

Window Managers

Stacking

  • 2bwm

  • Metacity
  • Muffin

  • PekWM
  • Sawfish
  • TinyWM
  • Twin
  • Window Maker
  • wm2
  • Xfwm4

Tiling

  • i3
  • Bspwm
  • Ion3
  • Notion
  • Ratpoison
  • Stumpwm
  • WMFS
  • WMFS2

Dynamic

  • awesome
  • catwm
  • dwm
  • echinus
  • FrankenWM
  • spectrwm
  • Qtile
  • wmii
  • xmonad

Terminal Emulators

  • Eterm
  • Final Term
  • Gnome-Terminal
  • Guake
  • Konsole
  • LilyTerm
  • LXTerminal
  • Pantheon
  • ROXTerm
  • rxvt-unicode

File Managers

item.title: Linux Software
item.description:
System

Z shell
A shell designed for interactive use, although it is also a powerful scripting language.
fish shell
The friendly interactive shell that attempts to be more interactive and user-friendly than former shells.
rxvt-unicode
Terminal emulator with International language support through Unicode, displays multiple font types and support for Perl extensions.
Sakura
Simple but powerful libvte based terminal emulator, supporting utf-8 and input methods as provided by gtk+ and pango libraries.
lm_sensors
Provides tools and drivers for monitoring temperatures, voltage, and fans.
htop
An interactive system-monitor that shows a frequently updated list of running processes.
Conky
A highly configurable system monitor.
Bleachbit
Clean your system and free disk space. Deletes cache, cookies, history, temp files, logs, and junk.

Security

iptables
Allows a system administrator to configure the tables provided by the Linux kernel firewall.
FireHOL
Builds secure, stateful firewalls from easy to understand, human-readable configurations.
DNSCrypt
A protocol to improve DNS security. It prevents DNS spoofing and uses cryptographic signatures.
TrueCrypt 7.1a
A discontinued source-available freeware utility used for disk encryption.
KeePass
A lightweight and easy-to-use password manager. Strong security, portable, multiple user keys, and password generator.
LastPass
Save your passwords and keep everything organized in your LastPass vault.

Internet

Firefox
Open-source web browser developed by the Mozilla Foundation.
Chrome
Closed-source web browser developed by Google.
Chromium
Open-source web browser project from which Google Chrome draws its source code.
Decentraleyes
Protects you against tracking through free, centralized, content delivery.
uBlock Origin
Ad Blocker that's easy on memory and CPU, yet can load thousands more filters than other popular blockers.
HTTPS Everywhere
Browser extension that encrypts your communications with many major websites.
NoScript
Blocks malicious scripts and allows JavaScript and Java content only from sites you trust.
Privacy Badger
Automatically analyze and block any tracker or ad that violates the principle of user consent.
Google Public DNS
Global Domain Name System resolution service that you can use as an alternative to your current DNS provider.

Production

LibreOffice
Free, open-source office suite and compatible alternative to Microsoft Office.
LaTeX
High-quality typesetting system designed for the production of technical and scientific documentation.
Leafpad
GTK+ text editor that emphasizes simplicity.
Blender
Professional, free and open-source 3D graphics and animation software.
GIMP
Free and open-source raster graphics editor used for image retouching and editing, free-form drawing.
Pinta
Free, open-source program for drawing and image editing.
Krita
Digital painting application based on Qt 5 and the KDE Frameworks 5.
Inkscape
Create vector graphics such as illustrations, diagrams, line arts, charts, logos and complex paintings.
Scribus
Professional layout and publishing software supporting EPS and SVG import/export, and PDF support.
Lightworks
Free and Paid video editor supporting resolutions up to 4K.
Pitivi
Open-source, non-linear video editor.
LMMS
Cross-platform music production software combining the features of trackers, sequencers and synthesizers.
Audacity
Free, easy-to-use, multi-track audio editor and recorder.

Media

MPV
Minimal, powerful media player that's highly customizable.
VLC
Multimedia player and framework that plays most multimedia files and doesn't require codec packs.
MPD
A flexible, powerful, server-side application for playing music.
MOC
Console audio player designed to be powerful and easy to use.
cmus
Small, fast and powerful console music player
FFmpeg
Record, convert and stream audio and video.
feh
Image viewer aimed mostly at console users. Unlike most other viewers, it does not have a fancy GUI, but simply displays images.
Plex
Organizes your video, music, and photo collections and streams them to all of your screens.

Utilities

Xarchiver
Lightweight desktop independent archive manager.
p7zip
Archive compression utility that supports multiple formats.
Okular
Universal document viewer based developed by KDE.
ImageMagick
Software suite to create, edit, compose, or convert bitmap images.
CopyQ
Advanced clipboard manager with editing and scripting features.
ANGRYsearch
Linux file search, instant results as you type.
screenFetch
The Bash Screenshot Information Tool.
Easystroke
A gesture-recognition application for movements you make with your mouse, pen, finger etc.
Plank
Meant to be the simplest dock on the planet.
Variety
Open-source wallpaper changer packed with great features, while slim and easy to use.
AnyDesk
Remote Desktop application that uses a video codec specifically designed for graphical user interfaces.
rsync
Provides fast incremental file transfer.
Acronis True Image
Provides data protection including, backup, archive, access and recovery.
Borg Backup
Deduplicating backup program. Optionally, it supports compression and authenticated encryption.
Wolfram|Alpha
Computational knowledge engine and answer engine.

Gaming

Steam
Delivers a range of games straight to a desktop with automatic updates.
GOG
A vast selection of classic and new games, DRM-free.
G2A
Buy and sell legit game CD-Keys for Steam, Origin, Uplay, Battle.net, Xbox, PSN and more.
Intel Drivers
Graphics card drivers.
NVIDIA Drivers
Graphics card drivers.
AMD Drivers
Graphics card drivers.
OpenCL
Parallel programming specification developed by the Khronos Group.
FurMark
OpenGL benchmark test for measuring the performance of a graphics card.
Open Broadcaster Software
Open-source program for recording and live streaming. Stream to Twitch, YouTube and many other providers.

Communication

Thunderbird
Open-source, cross-platform email, news, and chat client developed by the Mozilla Foundation.
Discord
Voice and text chat app designed specifically for gaming communities.
Mumble
Open-source, low-latency, high quality voice chat.
TeamSpeak
Voice chat for online gaming, education and training, internal business communication .
Skype
Video chat, text messaging and voice calls.
Telegram
Mssaging app with a focus on speed and security.
TeamViewer
Easy, fast and secure remote access to Windows, Mac and Linux systems.
RetroShare
Secure chat and file sharing features. Includes screenshots, a wiki and support forum.

Development

XAMPP
An easy to install Apache distribution containing MariaDB, PHP and Perl.
VirtualBox
Open-source, full virtualizer for x86 hardware, targeted at server, desktop and embedded use.
VMware
Hosted hypervisor that runs on x64 versions of Windows and Linux operating systems.
Ubuntu Server
Ubuntu edition configured for web server. Can be installed in a virtual machine.
CentOS
A free rebuild of source packages from the Red Hat Enterprise Linux.
Debian
The Stable Linux distribution is one of the most popular for personal computers and network servers.
Windows Server
Supports enterprise-level management, data storage, applications, and communications.
Android Studio
The Official IDE for Android. Provides the fastest tools for building apps on every type of Android device.
Xamarin
Build & design a mobile app using cross-platform development software which simplifies mobile application creation.
Microsoft Azure
Cloud computing platform for deploying applications and services through Microsoft-managed data centers.
Digital Ocean
Simple cloud computing web host, built for developers, pay-as-you-use based model.
FileZilla
Free, open-source FTP solution for both client and server.

Programming

Emacs
Extensible, customizable, self-documenting real-time display editor,
Vim
An improved version of the vi editor distributed with most UNIX systems.
Eclipse
IDE primarily intended for development in Java, but also supports other languages.
NetBeans
IDE primarily intended for development in Java, but also supports other languages, in particular PHP, C/C++ and HTML5.
Code::Blocks
C, C++ and Fortran IDE built around wxWidgets, designed to be extensible and configurable.
Sublime Text 3
A sophisticated text editor for code, markup and prose. Use with Package Control.
Visual Studio Code
Text editor redefined and optimized for building and debugging modern web and cloud applications.
Atom
Text editor that's modern, approachable, yet hackable to the core. Full-featured, right out of the box.
Java
General-purpose programming language that is concurrent, class-based, object-oriented.
PHP
Server-side scripting language designed for web development.
Perl
High-level, general-purpose, interpreted, dynamic programming language.
Python
High-level, general-purpose, interpreted, dynamic programming language. Commonly used with Django and Flask frameworks.
Ruby
A dynamic programming language with a focus on simplicity and productivity. Commonly used with Rails framework.
Node.js
Event-driven I/O server-side JavaScript environment based on V8.

Plugins & Runtimes

Java
Allows applets written in the Java programming language to run inside various browsers.
Flash
Views content created with Adobe Flash, including Internet applications, and streaming video and audio.
Pipelight
A wrapper for using Windows plugins in Linux browsers, allowing you to access services which are otherwise not available.

item.title: MPC-HC
item.description:
Versions

MPC-HC

Media Player Classic - Home Cinema
The Default Player

Download (x86 for compatibility with MadVR and xy-SubFilter).

CCCP

Combined Community Codec Pack
MPC-HC with a collected archive of codecs.

Download

KCP

Kawaii Codec Pack
MPC-HC with a codec pack that contains the latest DirectShow components.

Download

DirectShow Components

The following software is included in KCP but can be downloaded and installed separately with default MPC-HC.

  • madVR - High quality gpu assisted video renderer.
  • xy-vsfilter / XySubFilter - Superior subtitle renderer.
  • LAV-Filters - A package with the fastest and most actively developed DirectShow Media Splitter and Decoders.
  • ReClock - Addresses the problem of audio judder by adapting media for smooth playback OR utilized for bit perfect audio.

Other components:

  • Haali Media Splitter - A powerful decoder and splitter that supports multitrack and multisegment linked as well as concatenated files.

Configuration

The following settings are for very high quality playback and are not recommended for a slow computer or laptop. Settings can easily be lowered for slower hardware. You can monitor the dropped frames and presentation glitches by pressing Ctrl+J to open the madVR playback statistics. You may need to adjust your settings to match your graphics card's requirements.

MPC-HC

This setup is based on a KCP installation.

Image guide in progress.

Custom Monitor Refresh Rate

CAUTION! Overclocking can damage your monitor.

If your monitor is limited to 60Hz you can overclock or underclock the refresh rate by a multiple of 24 (24Hz, 48Hz, 72Hz) for best playback.

Not all Automatic Timings will work with all monitors. You may have to edit the Front porch, Back porch and Sync Width.

Download

http://www.monitortests.com/forum/Thread-Custom-Resolution-Utility-CRU

Guide

http://linustechtips.com/main/topic/31526-overclocking-your-monitor-refresh-rate-amd-gpus/

item.title: VirtualBox Server
item.description:
Download

https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Downloads

Port Forwarding

Get Linux Guest IP address in terminal using:

ip addr show

You will get something like:

eth0: inet 10.0.2.15 (example)
  • From VirtualBox Menu, go to Settings → Network
  • Or if the VM is running, from the Toolbar Menu, go to Devices → Network → Network Settings
  • Set Network Adapter to Attached to: NAT
  • Click the Port Forwarding button
  • Use the table below to find the correct IP and Port.
  • You can now access the sever from your Host machine's web browser by visiting http://127.0.0.1:8888 or http://localhost:8888.
Name Protocol Host IP Host Port Guest IP Guest Port
HTTP TCP 127.0.0.1 8888 10.0.2.15 80
SSH TCP 127.0.0.1 3022 10.0.2.15 22
Django TCP 127.0.0.1 8000 10.0.2.15 8000
Rails TCP 127.0.0.1 3000 10.0.2.15 3000
webpy TCP 127.0.0.1 8080 10.0.2.15 8080

Website Setup

Apache Example

<VirtualHost *:80>
    ServerAdmin webmaster@example.com
    ServerName 127.0.0.1:8888
    DocumentRoot /var/www/example/public/

        Options Indexes FollowSymLinks MultiViews
        AllowOverride All
        Order allow,deny
        allow from all

    ErrorLog /var/www/example/logs/error.log
    CustomLog /var/www/example/logs/access.log combined
</VirtualHost>

Nginx Example

server {
    listen 80;

    server_name 127.0.0.1:8888;
    root /var/www/example/public;
    index index.html index.htm index.php;

    access_log /var/log/nginx/localhost.access_log;
    error_log /var/log/nginx/localhost.error_log info;
}

Multiple Sites

https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/how-to-configure-single-and-multiple-wordpress-site-settings-with-nginx

FTP

Host: 127.0.0.1
Port: 3022
Protocol: SFTP
Logon Type: Normal

item.title: Web Server
item.description:
This guide is for Namecheap, Vultr and Debian Linux and covers both Apache and Nginx Servers.

Use the following commands as a template for your site.

Namecheap Domain

DNS

Manage Namecheap BasicDNS

In Advanced DNS, manage Host Records

Manage Host Records through Vultr DNS.

In Advanced DNS, choose Custom DNS.

Add ns1.vultr.com and ns2.vultr.com

SSL

After setting up Server, use Linux to create SSL.

Create Directory you want to store certificate and key in.

sudo mkdir /etc/nginx/ssl
cd /etc/nginx/ssl

Genereate CSR and Key

sudo openssl req -new -newkey rsa:2048 -nodes -keyout example_com.key -out example_com.csr

Purchase your SSL Certificate from Namecheap. Submit your generated example_com.csr file by following their instructions. Do not lose or delete your example_com.key. Do not reveal your key to anyone or it will be compromised.

Namecheap will send back a crt and ca-bundle file to be used by your Server.

NGINX

You will need to combine both crt and ca-bundle files together and place in your created directory, such as /etc/nginx/ssl/.

sudo cat example_com.crt example_com.ca-bundle >> cert_chain.crt

Remove any extra linebreaks or whitespace in your cert_chain.crt file.

server {
listen 443 ssl default_server;

ssl on;
ssl_certificate /etc/nginx/ssl/cert_chain.crt;
ssl_certificate_key /etc/nginx/ssl/example_com.key;
ssl_protocols  TLSv1.1 TLSv1.2;
...

Set Permissions

sudo chown -R root:root /etc/nginx/ssl
sudo chmod -R 600 /etc/nginx/ssl

Vultr Hosting

Deploy New Server

After completion, you'll get an email with login credentials.
Login SSH as root. Use Putty if on Windows.
Change root password as required.

DNS

In Vultr DNS set your Records:

A Server IPv4 Address
AAAA Server IPv6 Address
A www Server IPv4 Address
CNAME . Domain Name
NS ns1.vultr.com
NS ns2.vultr.com

Debian

It is recommended to create a new user and disable root SSH login.

Add a new user

adduser username

Enter new password.
Press enter to skip steps if needed.

Add user to sudoers

apt-get install sudo
adduser username sudo

Logout of root with exit.
Login with new username.

Disable Root SSH

sudo nano /etc/ssh/sshd_config

Change PermitRootLogin yes to no

sudo service sshd restart

Update Package List

sudo apt-get update && dist-upgrade

Directories

Make directories on your server:

/var/www/example.com
/var/www/example.com/public
/var/www/example.com/logs

NTP

Network Time Protocol daemon

sudo apt-get install ntp ntpdate

Apache

sudo apt-get install apache2 apache2-doc

Go to IP address to see site

Virtual Hosts

sudo nano /etc/apache2/sites-available/example.com.conf
<VirtualHost *:80>
 ServerAdmin webmaster@example.com
 ServerName example.com
 ServerAlias www.example.com
 DocumentRoot /var/www/example.com/public/
 <Directory /var/www/example.com>
      Options Indexes FollowSymLinks MultiViews
      AllowOverride All
      Order allow,deny
      allow from all
      </Directory>
ErrorLog /var/www/example.com/logs/error.log
CustomLog /var/www/example.com/logs/access.log combined
</VirtualHost>

Disable Default Virtual Host

sudo a2dissite 000-default.conf

Enable new Virtual Host

sudo a2ensite example.com.conf

Enable mod_rewrite and mod_write

sudo a2enmod rewrite

In your website .htaccess, uncomment RewriteBase / if available.

Reload & Restart Apache

sudo service apache2 reload
sudo service apache2 restart

Nginx

sudo apt-get install nginx

If you already have Apache installed, you will need to remove, disable, or change to listen on port other than 80.

Uninstall Apache with:

sudo service apache2 stop
sudo apt-get remove apache2

Htaccess Rules can be converted to Nginx using http://www.anilcetin.com/convert-apache-htaccess-to-nginx/

Server Blocks

Create a new file in sites-available.

sudo nano /etc/nginx/sites-available/example.com
server {
    listen 80;
    server_name example.com www.example.com;
    server_name_in_redirect off;
    access_log /var/log/nginx/localhost.access_log;
    error_log /var/log/nginx/localhost.error_log info;
    root /var/www/example.com/public;
    if ($http_host != "www.example.com") {
        rewrite ^ http://www.example.com$request_uri permanent;
    }
    index index.php index.html index.htm default.html default.htm;
    # Support Clean (aka Search Engine Friendly) URLs
    location / {
        try_files $uri $uri/ /index.php?q=$request_uri;
        include  /etc/nginx/mime.types;
    }
    # deny running scripts inside writable directories
    location ~* /(images|cache|media|logs|tmp)/.*\.(php|pl|py|jsp|asp|sh|cgi)$ {
        return 403;
        error_page 403 /403_error.html;
    }
    location ~ \.php$ {
        # With php5-fpm:
        fastcgi_pass unix:/var/run/php5-fpm.sock;
        # With php5-cgi alone:
        # fastcgi_pass  127.0.0.1:9000;
        fastcgi_index index.php;
        include fastcgi_params;
        fastcgi_param SCRIPT_FILENAME $document_root$fastcgi_script_name;
        include /etc/nginx/fastcgi.conf;
    }
    # caching of files
    location ~* \.(ico|pdf|flv)$ {
        expires 1y;
    }
    location ~* \.(js|css|png|jpg|jpeg|gif|swf|xml|txt)$ {
        expires 14d;
    }
}

Remove the default in sites-enabled.

sudo rm /etc/nginx/sites-enabled/default

Gzip

sudo nano /etc/nginx/nginx.conf
http {
[...]
    gzip on;
    gzip_disable "msie6";
    gzip_vary on;
    gzip_proxied any;
    gzip_comp_level 6;
    gzip_min_length 1100;
    gzip_buffers 16 8k;
    gzip_http_version 1.1;
    gzip_types text/plain text/css application/json application/javascript text/xml$
[...]
}

Fast-CGI Buffers

sudo nano /etc/nginx/nginx.conf
http {
[...]
    fastcgi_buffers 8 16k;
    fastcgi_buffer_size 32k;
    fastcgi_connect_timeout 300;
    fastcgi_send_timeout 300;
    fastcgi_read_timeout 300;
[...]

Restart Nginx to load changes

sudo service nginx restart

PHP

PHP 5

sudo apt-get install php5-common php5-dev make php-pear libpcre3-dev libapache2-mod-php5 php5-cli

PHP 7

sudo nano /etc/apt/sources.list
deb http://packages.dotdeb.org jessie all
wget https://www.dotdeb.org/dotdeb.gpg
sudo apt-key add dotdeb.gpg
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get -y install php7.0-fpm php7.0-mysql php7.0-simplexml php7.0-curl php7.0-gd php7.0-intl php7.0-mcrypt php7.0-pspell php7.0-recode php7.0-tidy php7.0-xmlrpc php7.0-xsl php7.0-mbstring php7.0-zip php-gettext php-pear

php.ini Locations

Apache

/etc/php5/apache2/php.ini
/etc/php/7.0/apache2/php.ini

Nginx

/etc/php5/fpm/php.ini
/etc/php/7.0/fpm/php.ini

Upload Temp Directory

Uncomment and set your path:
upload_tmp_dir = /var/www/example.com/public/tmp

Change Upload Limits

Default upload size is 2MB

Edit php.ini

max_execution_time
max_input_time
default_socket_timeout
memory_limit
post_max_size
upload_max_filesize
max_file_uploads

Edit /etc/nginx/nginx.conf

client_max_body_size 20M;

Restart php5-fpm (Nginx)

sudo service php5-fpm reload
sudo service php5-fpm restart

Restart Apache / Nginx

sudo service apache2 restart
sudo service nginx restart

Zend OPcache

PHP7

Add to end of php.ini:

zend_extension=opcache.so

APC

PHP5

Alternative PHP Cache

sudo apt-get install php-apc

create /etc/php5/conf.d/apc.ini

extension=apc.so
; enable APC
apc.enabled=1
; The number of shared memory segments
apc.shm_segments=1
; The size of each shared memory segment
apc.shm_size=64
; The number of seconds a cache entry is allowed to idle in a slot in case this
; cache entry slot is needed by another entry.
apc.ttl=7200

APCu

PHP7

Alternative PHP Cache

https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/PHP#APCu

sudo apt-get install php7.0-dev
pecl channel-update pecl.php.net
pecl install -Z apcu
echo "extension=apcu.so" | sudo tee -a /etc/php/7.0/mods-available/apcu.ini
sudo ln -s /etc/php/7.0/mods-available/apcu.ini /etc/php/7.0/fpm/conf.d/30-apcu.ini
sudo ln -s /etc/php/7.0/mods-available/apcu.ini /etc/php/7.0/cli/conf.d/30-apcu.ini
apc.ttl=7200
apc.enable_cli=1

PHP-FPM

FastCGI Process Manager

Use with Nginx

You will need to install from non-free repositories.

sudo nano /etc/apt/sources.list

Add to Sources:

deb http://httpredir.debian.org/debian jessie main contrib non-free
deb-src http://httpredir.debian.org/debian jessie main contrib non-free

deb http://httpredir.debian.org/debian jessie-updates main contrib non-free
deb-src http://httpredir.debian.org/debian jessie-updates main contrib non-free

deb http://security.debian.org/ jessie/updates main contrib non-free
deb-src http://security.debian.org/ jessie/updates main contrib non-free
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install php5-fpm
sudo apt-get install php7.0-fpm

Restart

sudo service php5-fpm restart
sudo service php7.0-fpm restart

MySQL

sudo apt-get install mysql-server php5-mysql
sudo mysql_secure_installation
Change the root password? [Y/n] n
Remove anonymous users? [Y/n] y
Disallow root login remotely? [Y/n] y
Remove test database and access to it? [Y/n] y
Reload privilege tables now? [Y/n] y

Enter mysql root password

phpMyAdmin

sudo apt-get install phpmyadmin

Apache

sudo nano /etc/apache2/apache2.conf

Add to bottom of file:

Include /etc/phpmyadmin/apache.conf

Change KeepAlive On to Off

NGINX

Enable access to phpMyAdmin

server {
[...]
location /phpmyadmin {
        root /usr/share/;
        index index.php index.html index.htm;
        location ~ ^/phpmyadmin/(.+\.php)$ {
            try_files $uri =404;
            root /usr/share/;
            # With php5-fpm:
            fastcgi_pass unix:/var/run/php5-fpm.sock;
            # With php5-cgi alone:
            # fastcgi_pass  127.0.0.1:9000;
            fastcgi_index index.php;
            fastcgi_param SCRIPT_FILENAME $document_root$fastcgi_script_name;
            include /etc/nginx/fastcgi_params;
    }
    location ~* ^/phpmyadmin/(.+\.(jpg|jpeg|gif|css|png|js|ico|html|xml|txt))$ {
        root /usr/share/;
    }
}
location /phpMyAdmin {
        rewrite ^/* /phpmyadmin last;
}
[...]
}

Create a symlink in sites-enabled.

sudo ln -s /etc/nginx/sites-available/example.com /etc/nginx/sites-enabled/example.com

Fail2ban

sudo apt-get install fail2ban
cd /etc/fail2ban
sudo cp jail.conf jail.local
sudo nano jail.local

Permissions

sudo chown -R www-data:www-data /var/www
sudo chmod -R g+w /var/www
sudo usermod -a -G www-data username
id username
groups username
sudo nano /etc/apache2/envvars

Add to bottom of the file:

umask 007

Restart

sudo service apache2 restart
sudo service nginx restart

FTP

Host: Server IP Address
Protocol: SFTP
Logon Type: Normal
Default remote directory: /var/www/example.com/public

www-data

Enable SFTP upload writing to files owned by www-data.

Create Group and add User 

sudo adduser --group www-pub
sudo usermod -a -G www-pub www-data
sudo usermod -a -G www-pub username

Change directories and files owner 

sudo chown -R www-data:www-pub /var/www

Change directories and files permissions 

sudo chmod 2775 /var/www

sudo find /var/www -type d -exec chmod 2775 {} +
sudo find /var/www -type f -exec chmod 0664 {} +

item.title: Windows Software
item.description:
System

Microsoft Sysinternals
Advanced system utilities.
Bleachbit
Clean your system and free disk space. Deletes cache, cookies, history, temp files, logs, and junk.
CCleaner
Cleans all areas of your computer, protects your privacy, and makes it faster and more secure.
Defraggler
Defrag entire hard drives or individual files. Works with HDD and SSD.
Speccy
Detailed information on every piece of hardware in your computer.
HWMonitor
Hardware monitoring program that reads PC systems main health sensors.
HD Tune
Measures drive's performance, scans for errors, checks health status, and securely erase all data.
CrystalDiskInfo
A HDD/SSD utility software which supports S.M.A.R.T. and a part of USB-HDD.
WinDirStat
Disk usage statistics viewer and cleanup tool.
CPU-Z
Processor and RAM information tool with temperatures.
GPU-Z
Grahpics Card information tool with temperatures.
Revo Uninstaller
Lists installed programs and scans for leftovers the Windows default doesn't remove.

Security

Kaspersky
Paid Antivirus & Firewall. Protects your privacy, money, Identity, photos and family against online threats.
ESET
Paid Antivirus & Firewall. All-in-one protection against all types of online threats.
Bitdefender
Paid & Free Antivirus & Firewall. Protects you while browsing, shopping and banking. Uncovers and removes malware.
Avast
Paid & Free Antivirus. Detect viruses, malware and more, plus strengthen your home network.
Malwarebytes
Detects and removes malware with industry-leading anti-malware, anti-spyware, and anti-rootkit tech.
Anti-Rootkit
Malwarebytes, drills down and removes even deeply embedded rootkits.
Comodo Firewall
Removes existing viruses, blocks all unwanted Internet attacks, protects your system completely.
DNSCrypt
A protocol to improve DNS security. It prevents DNS spoofing and uses cryptographic signatures.
TrueCrypt 7.1a
A discontinued source-available freeware utility used for disk encryption.
GnuPG
Encrypts, decrypts, signs, digests files using strong cryptography.
KeePass
A lightweight and easy-to-use password manager. Strong security, portable, multiple user keys, and password generator.
LastPass
Save your passwords and keep everything organized in your LastPass vault.

Internet

Firefox
Open-source web browser developed by the Mozilla Foundation.
Chrome
Closed-source web browser developed by Google.
Chromium
Open-source web browser project from which Google Chrome draws its source code.
Decentraleyes
Protects you against tracking through free, centralized, content delivery.
uBlock Origin
Ad Blocker that's easy on memory and CPU, yet can load thousands more filters than other popular blockers.
HTTPS Everywhere
Browser extension that encrypts your communications with many major websites.
NoScript
Blocks malicious scripts and allows JavaScript and Java content only from sites you trust.
Privacy Badger
Automatically analyze and block any tracker or ad that violates the principle of user consent.
Google Public DNS
Global Domain Name System resolution service that you can use as an alternative to your current DNS provider.

Production

LibreOffice
Free, open-source office suite and compatible alternative to Microsoft Office.
Notepad++
Notepad replacement and source code editor which supports several programming languages.
Lightworks
Free and Paid video editor supporting resolutions up to 4K.
Blender
Professional, free and open-source 3D graphics and animation software.
Adobe Creative Cloud
Industry standard graphic design, video editing, web development, photography, and cloud services.
GIMP
Free and open-source raster graphics editor used for image retouching and editing, free-form drawing.
Krita
Digital painting application based on Qt 5 and the KDE Frameworks 5.
Inkscape
Create vector graphics such as illustrations, diagrams, line arts, charts, logos and complex paintings.
Scribus
Professional layout and publishing software supporting EPS and SVG import/export, and PDF support.
Audacity
Free, easy-to-use, multi-track audio editor and recorder.

Media

MPC-HC
Compact media player with classic look and feel, but provides advanced features and plugin support.
KCP
Kawaii Codec Pack. MPC-HC with the latest DirectShow components and focus on Hi10P content playback and quality.
VLC
Multimedia player and framework that plays most multimedia files and doesn't require codec packs.
mpv
Minimal, powerful media player that's highly customizable.
foobar2000
Music player with simple UI, low memory use and plugin support for new features.
Equalizer APO
A system-wide equalizer. Used with EQ APO or Peace GUI.
FFmpeg
Record, convert and stream audio and video.
CDisplayEx
Comic book archive viewer and sequential image viewer.
Plex
Organizes your video, music, and photo collections and streams them to all of your screens.

Utilities

Ninite
The easiest, fastest way to update or install software. Downloads and installs programs automatically in the background.
Chocolatey
A Machine Package Manager, like apt-get for Windows.
Everything
Locate files and folders by name instantly. Quick file indexing, minimal resource usage.
Acronis True Image
Provides data protection including, backup, archive, access and recovery.
7-Zip
Free archive compression utility that supports multiple formats.
Sumatra PDF
PDF, eBook, XPS, DjVu, CHM, Comic Book (CBZ and CBR) reader.
Rufus
Create bootable USB flash drives for operating systems.
AutoHotkey
Macro-creation software that allows users to automate repetitive tasks.
Wolfram|Alpha
Computational knowledge engine and answer engine.

Gaming

Steam
Delivers a range of games straight to a desktop with automatic updates.
GOG
A vast selection of classic and new games, DRM-free.
G2A
Buy and sell legit game CD-Keys for Steam, Origin, Uplay, Battle.net, Xbox, PSN and more.
Intel Drivers
Graphics chip drivers.
NVIDIA Drivers
Graphics card drivers.
PhysX
Taps into the power of NVIDIA’s GeForce GTX GPUs to create incredible effects and scenes.
AMD Drivers
Graphics card drivers.
DirectX
Microsoft end-user runtime for 3D graphics.
EVGA Precision
Overclock and adjust your graphics cards fanspeed. Display ingame temp, framerate, and clock monitoring.
MSI Afterburner
Overclocking utility which gives you full control of your graphics cards and detailed overview of your hardware.
FurMark
OpenGL benchmark test for measuring the performance of a graphics card.
SpeedFan
Monitors voltages, fan speeds and temperatures in computers with hardware monitor chips.
Reshade
Advanced post-processing injector and graphics tweaks.
Open Broadcaster Software
Open-source program for recording and live streaming. Stream to Twitch, YouTube and many other providers.

Communication

Thunderbird
Open-source, cross-platform email, news, and chat client developed by the Mozilla Foundation.
Discord
Voice and text chat app designed specifically for gaming communities.
Mumble
Open-source, low-latency, high quality voice chat.
TeamSpeak
Voice chat for online gaming, education and training, internal business communication .
Skype
Video chat, text messaging and voice calls.
VoiceMeeter
Mix audio sources coming from devices as well as applications.
Telegram
Mssaging app with a focus on speed and security.
TeamViewer
Easy, fast and secure remote access to Windows, Mac and Linux systems.
RetroShare
Secure chat and file sharing features. Includes screenshots, a wiki and support forum.

Development

XAMPP
An easy to install Apache distribution containing MariaDB, PHP and Perl.
VirtualBox
Open-source, full virtualizer for x86 hardware, targeted at server, desktop and embedded use.
VMware
Hosted hypervisor that runs on x64 versions of Windows and Linux operating systems.
Ubuntu Server
Ubuntu edition configured for web server. Can be installed in a virtual machine.
CentOS
A free rebuild of source packages from the Red Hat Enterprise Linux.
Windows Server
Supports enterprise-level management, data storage, applications, and communications.
Android Studio
The Official IDE for Android. Provides the fastest tools for building apps on every type of Android device.
Xamarin
Build & design a mobile app using cross-platform development software which simplifies mobile application creation.
Microsoft Azure
Cloud computing platform for deploying applications and services through Microsoft-managed data centers.
Digital Ocean
Simple cloud computing web host, built for developers, pay-as-you-use based model.
Putty
Free implementation of SSH and Telnet for Windows and Unix platforms.
FileZilla
Free, open-source FTP solution for both client and server.

Programming

Visual Studio
Collection of developer tools and services to help you create apps for the Microsoft platform and beyond.
JetBrains
Technology-leading software vendor specializing in the creation of intelligent development tools.
Qt
A cross-platform application framework that is widely used for developing application software.
Eclipse
IDE primarily intended for development in Java, but also supports other languages.
NetBeans
IDE primarily intended for development in Java, but also supports other languages, in particular PHP, C/C++ and HTML5.
Code::Blocks
C, C++ and Fortran IDE built around wxWidgets, designed to be extensible and configurable.
Sublime Text 3
A sophisticated text editor for code, markup and prose. Use with Package Control.
Visual Studio Code
Text editor redefined and optimized for building and debugging modern web and cloud applications.
Atom
Text editor that's modern, approachable, yet hackable to the core. Full-featured, right out of the box.
Java
General-purpose programming language that is concurrent, class-based, object-oriented.
PHP
Server-side scripting language designed for web development.
Perl
High-level, general-purpose, interpreted, dynamic programming language.
Python
High-level, general-purpose, interpreted, dynamic programming language. Commonly used with Django and Flask frameworks.
Ruby
A dynamic programming language with a focus on simplicity and productivity. Commonly used with Rails framework.
Node.js
Event-driven I/O server-side JavaScript environment based on V8.

Plugins & Runtimes

Java
Allows applets written in the Java programming language to run inside various browsers.
Flash
Views content created with Adobe Flash, including Internet applications, and streaming video and audio.
Silverlight
Development tool for creating engaging, interactive user experiences for Web and mobile applications.
.NET Framework
3.0 | 3.5 | 4.0 | 4.5
Visual C++
2013 | 2012 | 2010 (64-bit) | 2008 (64-bit) | 2005 (64-bit)

item.title: macOS Software
item.description:
System

Onyx
Multifunction utility that performs maintenance, cleanup, turn on hidden functions and more.
CCleaner
Cleans all areas of your computer, protects your privacy, and makes it faster and more secure.
AppCleaner
Thoroughly uninstall unwanted app's files throughout your System.
MacUtil
Customize the look and functionality of the dock, finder and user interfaces.
Xtrafinder
Adds Tabs and features to Mac Finder.
CPU-X
Shows the CPU info like: CPU name, Code Name, Package, Technology, Core Speed, Multiplier, Bus Speed, Rated FSB enz.
Cuda-Z
Shows information about CUDA-enabled GPUs and GPGPUs. Works with NVIDIA Geforce, Quadro and Tesla cards, ION chipsets.
coconutBattery
Shows you live information about the battery in your Mac and iOS devices.
Disk Inventory X
Disk usage utility that shows the sizes of files and folders in a graphical way called treemaps.

Security

Little Snitch
Network Monitor that provides realtime traffic information, connectivity status and much more.
Airlock
Displays a regularly updated list of service information for the Wi-Fi access points.
Hidden
If your device is lost or stolen, Hidden will show you where it is and who has it.
TrueCrypt
A discontinued source-available freeware utility used for disk encryption.
MacGPG
Encrypts, decrypts, signs, digests files using strong cryptography.
KeePassX
A lightweight and easy-to-use password manager. Strong security, portable, multiple user keys, and password generator.

Internet

Firefox
Open-source web browser developed by the Mozilla Foundation.
Chrome
Closed-source web browser developed by Google.
Chromium
Open-source web browser project from which Google Chrome draws its source code.
Decentraleyes
Protects you against tracking through free, centralized, content delivery.
uBlock Origin
Ad Blocker that's easy on memory and CPU, yet can load thousands more filters than other popular blockers.
HTTPS Everywhere
Browser extension that encrypts your communications with many major websites.
NoScript
Blocks malicious scripts and allows JavaScript and Java content only from sites you trust.
Privacy Badger
Automatically analyze and block any tracker or ad that violates the principle of user consent.
Google Public DNS
Global Domain Name System resolution service that you can use as an alternative to your current DNS provider.

Production

LibreOffice
Free, open-source office suite and compatible alternative to Microsoft Office.
Textmate
Graphical text editor that support many different languages, syntax highlighting and packages.
Lightworks
Free and Paid video editor supporting resolutions up to 4K.
Blender
Professional, free and open-source 3D graphics and animation software.
Adobe Creative Cloud
Industry standard graphic design, video editing, web development, photography, and cloud services.
GIMP
Free and open-source raster graphics editor used for image retouching and editing, free-form drawing.
Krita
Digital painting application based on Qt 5 and the KDE Frameworks 5.
Inkscape
Create vector graphics such as illustrations, diagrams, line arts, charts, logos and complex paintings.
Scribus
Professional layout and publishing software supporting EPS and SVG import/export, and PDF support.
Audacity
Free, easy-to-use, multi-track audio editor and recorder.

Media

VLC
Multimedia player and framework that plays most multimedia files and doesn't require codec packs.
mpv
Minimal, powerful media player that's highly customizable.
Vox
Lightweight yet full-featured music player with a minimalistic UI reflecting the future.
XLD
Decode, convert, play various lossless audio files.
FFmpeg
Record, convert and stream audio and video.
Xee
Streamlined and convenient image viewer and browser.

Utilities

Homebrew
The missing package manager for OS X. Installs the packages you need that Apple didn’t.
Cakebrew
Manage your Homebrew formulas with style using Cakebrew.
Alfred
Boosts your efficiency with hotkeys, keywords, text expansion and more.
Acronis True Image
Provides data protection including, backup, archive, access and recovery.
7-Zip
Free archive compression utility that supports multiple formats.
UNetbootin
Allows you to create bootable Live USB drives.
Wolfram|Alpha
Computational knowledge engine and answer engine.
Dropzone
Makes it faster and easier to move and copy files, launch applications, upload to many different services, and more.
CloudApp
Easily share anything, anywhere.
TodoTxtMac
Minimalist, keyboard-driven to-do manager for Mac OS X that conforms to the todo.txt format spec.

Gaming

Steam
Delivers a range of games straight to a desktop with automatic updates.
GOG
A vast selection of classic and new games, DRM-free.
G2A
Buy and sell legit game CD-Keys for Steam, Origin, Uplay, Battle.net, Xbox, PSN and more.
Intel Drivers
Graphics card drivers.
NVIDIA Drivers
Graphics card drivers.
PhysX
Taps into the power of NVIDIA’s GeForce GTX GPUs to create incredible effects and scenes.
AMD Drivers
Graphics card drivers.
FurMark
OpenGL benchmark test for measuring the performance of a graphics card.
Open Broadcaster Software
Open-source program for recording and live streaming. Stream to Twitch, YouTube and many other providers.

Communication

Thunderbird
Open-source, cross-platform email, news, and chat client developed by the Mozilla Foundation.
Discord
Voice and text chat app designed specifically for gaming communities.
Mumble
Open-source, low-latency, high quality voice chat.
TeamSpeak
Voice chat for online gaming, education and training, internal business communication .
Skype
Video chat, text messaging and voice calls.
Telegram
Mssaging app with a focus on speed and security.
RetroShare
Secure chat and file sharing features. Includes screenshots, a wiki and support forum.
TeamViewer
Easy, fast and secure remote access to Windows, Mac and Linux systems.

Development

XAMPP
An easy to install Apache distribution containing MariaDB, PHP and Perl.
VirtualBox
Open-source, full virtualizer for x86 hardware, targeted at server, desktop and embedded use.
VMware
Hosted hypervisor that runs on x64 versions of Windows and Linux operating systems.
Ubuntu Server
Ubuntu edition configured for web server. Can be installed in a virtual machine.
CentOS
A free rebuild of source packages from the Red Hat Enterprise Linux.
Debian
The Stable Linux distribution is one of the most popular for personal computers and network servers.
Windows Server
Supports enterprise-level management, data storage, applications, and communications.
Android Studio
The Official IDE for Android. Provides the fastest tools for building apps on every type of Android device.
Microsoft Azure
Cloud computing platform for deploying applications and services through Microsoft-managed data centers.
Digital Ocean
Simple cloud computing web host, built for developers, pay-as-you-use based model.
FileZilla
Free, open-source FTP solution for both client and server.

Programming

JetBrains
Technology-leading software vendor specializing in the creation of intelligent development tools.
Eclipse
IDE primarily intended for development in Java, but also supports other languages.
NetBeans
IDE primarily intended for development in Java, but also supports other languages, in particular PHP, C/C++ and HTML5.
Code::Blocks
C, C++ and Fortran IDE built around wxWidgets, designed to be extensible and configurable.
Sublime Text 3
A sophisticated text editor for code, markup and prose. Use with Package Control.
Visual Studio Code
Text editor redefined and optimized for building and debugging modern web and cloud applications.
Atom
Text editor that's modern, approachable, yet hackable to the core. Full-featured, right out of the box.
Java
General-purpose programming language that is concurrent, class-based, object-oriented.
PHP
Server-side scripting language designed for web development.
Perl
High-level, general-purpose, interpreted, dynamic programming language.
Python
High-level, general-purpose, interpreted, dynamic programming language. Commonly used with Django and Flask frameworks.
Ruby
A dynamic programming language with a focus on simplicity and productivity. Commonly used with Rails framework.
Node.js
Event-driven I/O server-side JavaScript environment based on V8.

Plugins & Runtimes

Java
Allows applets written in the Java programming language to run inside various browsers.
Flash
Views content created with Adobe Flash, including Internet applications, and streaming video and audio.
Silverlight
Development tool for creating engaging, interactive user experiences for Web and mobile applications.
Mono
Open-source implementation of Microsoft's .NET Framework.
